SEC. 3. Permanent increase in limitations on expensing of certain depreciable business assets and real property. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase limitations on expensing of certain depreciable business assets and real property. This includes changes to the amounts for expensing and definitions of Section 179 property. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to increase limitations on expensing of certain depreciable business assets and real property, including changes to the amounts for expensing and definitions of Section 179 property as tangible property or computer software placed in service after 2002. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2009, excluding certain types of property like air conditioning or heating units.
